intro: Achyranthes lanata, commonly known as the hairy knotweed, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Achyranthes lanata is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along riverbanks.
